pages.text: Initially, the power of the new enchantments you created is too weak, so using a little chaos, it is possible to strengthen.

pages.title: Implementation
pages.text: Throw a dark grimoire and a tool that requires strengthening on the ground, and then scatter some chaotic powder. After that, a rift will open in the enchantment structure, invisible to the eye, if possible, which, if certain requirements are met, will consolidate and begin to feed the enchantment. According to your calculations, the gain is possible exactly 23 times.

As a result, it turns out that there are 24 forms for each corrupted enchantment (with some exceptions, the base of which is unsuitable for strengthening, for example, "infinity"). Each form was assigned its own letter of the Greek alphabet. Omega is the very first form, the weakest. Alpha is the last form, the most important.
